programme.title: Wilmington on Fire
programme.desc: On November 10, an armed mob of white supremacists opened fire on African American neighborhoods, slaughtering hundreds and driving thousands out of the city for good.

programme.title: NURSE.FIGHTER.BOY.
programme.desc: While working as a night-shift nurse to support her son, Jude, a widowed single mother undergoing treatment for sickle cell disease meets and enters into a relationship with Silence, a troubled and brooding boxer who becomes a father figure for the young boy.

programme.title: RIGAMO
programme.desc: In the midst of family loss and tragedy 6-year-old Kera Moore discovers she has the power to bring people back to life with her tears. However she quickly learns this gift requires an incredible sacrifice.

programme.title: FOR THE CAUSE
programme.desc: Mirai Scott, a civil rights attorney in Chicago, defends her estranged father, a former Black Panther, against a 30-year-old attempted murder charge. Long-held hostilities and accusations explode as Mirai aggressively pursues her fatherâ€™s defense.

programme.title: DAVID'S REVEIRE
programme.desc: David is living his lifelong dream of becoming a star trumpet player when he is struck by epilepsy and the unpredictable seizures.

programme.title: Upper Hand
programme.desc: Upper Hand dives into the nuanced challenges Black and brown communities have faced in finding their pathway into the new economy by way of technology access, skill development, and opportunity. Data journalist and author, Sherrell Dorsey, follows the thread of her grandfather's story, growing up in the Jim Crow south, his migration to Seattle, and how he leveraged a job in technology to lay the foundation for his family's economic future.

programme.title: JMAXX AND THE UNIVERSAL LANGUAGE
programme.desc: Jarrell Sullivan is a teenager with autism, who has a difficult time communicating with the world.

programme.title: MATERNALLY YOURS Episode 1
programme.desc: In this dramedy mini-series, 20-something Sheena is ready to move on from her small city of Alexandria, LA and head to New Orleans.

programme.title: MATERNALLY YOURS Episode 2
programme.desc: In this dramedy mini-series, 20-something Sheena is ready to move on from her small city of Alexandria, LA and head to New Orleans.

programme.title: MATERNALLY YOURS Episode 3
programme.desc: In this dramedy mini-series, 20-something Sheena is ready to move on from her small city of Alexandria, LA and head to New Orleans.

programme.title: MATERNALLY YOURS Episode 4
programme.desc: In this dramedy mini-series, 20-something Sheena is ready to move on from her small city of Alexandria, LA and head to New Orleans.

programme.title: Journey of Lion
programme.desc: Brother Howie is a Jamaican Rastafari who dreams of the land of his ancestors: Africa. On a journey in search of his roots and his identity he travels through three continents and (with great humor and sensitivity) discovers the world and Africa.

programme.title: MANGO WARS
programme.desc: Mango Wars, a comedy set in present day Kingston, Jamaica, follows Mr. Brown who runs a mango jelly business with his pregnant wife, Mrs. Brown. Fed up with the theft of mangoes from his mango tree and the impending birth of his first child, he develops an elaborate plan to catch the thief red handed. But when all of the traps are set off by unlikely elements, Mr. Brown has to rethink what really matters.

programme.title: Something Necessary
programme.desc: Joseph, a troubled young gang member who participated in the countrywide violence is drawn to Anne and her farm seemingly in search of redemption. Both he and Anne need something that only the other can give to allow them to shed the painful memories of their past and move on â€“ but will either of them find it?

programme.title: AFROPOLITAINE EP 1
programme.desc: Afropolitaine is a web-series focused on the Afro-French culture. Afropolitaine tells the story of two Paris-based millennials sisters and their family dynamics.

programme.desc: Afropolitaine is a web-series focused on the Afro-French culture. Afropolitaine tells the story of two Paris-based millennials sisters and their family dynamics.

programme.title: PALM TREES DOWN 3RD ST.
programme.desc: While searching for her father, Nikki meets her half-sister Winter for the first time on the streets of San Francisco.

programme.title: ELEPHANT IN THE ROOM
programme.desc: A former, female boxing champion and her business partner coach are mentoring two teenage girls, best friends through their non-profit gym.

programme.title: FUNNY MARRIED STUFF S2 Episode 1
programme.desc: The show combines improv humor and relatable situations, with a touch of marital lessons. At the end of the day, itâ€™s all about living, learning, and laughing with the one you love.

programme.desc: The show combines improv humor and relatable situations, with a touch of marital lessons. At the end of the day, itâ€™s all about living, learning, and laughing with the one you love.

programme.title: THE LONG ROAD TO HALL OF FAME
programme.desc: The Long Road To The Hall Of Fame is a feature length documentary about Malik Farrakhan, his life is a parable spanning the last 40 years of African-American history.

programme.title: BROTHERS HYPNOTIC
programme.desc: For the eight young men in the Hypnotic Brass Ensemble, 'brotherhood' is literal: they're all sons of anti-establishment jazz legend, Phil Cohran.

programme.title: BLACK GIRL IN PARIS
programme.desc: When a down on her luck aspiring writer runs out of money after moving to Paris, she meets a street-smart prostitute who takes her on a whirlwind adventure of passion, self-discovery and uninhibited sexual freedom.

programme.title: THE BEAST
programme.desc: An ordinary day at a Zulu cultural village. Shaka, their star performer, expresses his frustrations to his co-workers as he sits on display for tourists. On this day he reaches the end of his tether and his protest takes on Shakespearian proportion.

programme.title: KEEPING OUR LOVED ONES ALIVE
programme.desc: Based on testimonies of the mothers and family victims of state violence in the Baixada Fluminense, this documentary addresses police violence in the lowland of Rio de Janeiro and brings a critical view of the State’s brutality, especially against black youth

programme.title: FUNK FORCE
programme.desc: A 'dysfunktional' team of young black superheroes fight against a hip-hop sensation hell bent on hypnotizing the black community.

programme.title: Switch
programme.desc: A couple, Nessa and Camden, continue their tradition of looking through each others phones once a month, but questionable text messages reveal the truth.

programme.title: BEYOND THE PASSGE
programme.desc: Six years after a mysterious event destroyed civilization, a young girl sets out on a lone journey in hopes of saving her ailing grandfather. Little does she know, she's not alone in this dangerous new world.

programme.title: Bad Web Series S1 E1
programme.desc: Friends turn foes then friends again as this parody series pokes fun at the black comedy-drama genre while laughing at itself.

programme.desc: Friends turn foes then friends again as this parody series pokes fun at the black comedy-drama genre while laughing at itself.

programme.title: BLACK ABROAD
programme.desc: Two friends document their experiences traveling while meeting with local transplants to explore the modern African Diaspora.
